nathaliest wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I have a problem starting Heritrix 2.0 under windows from Java main,
> using:
> 
> Heritrix.main(new String[]{"-a testPassword"});
> 
> When I run this, I get the following message that indicates a
> successful launch:
> 
> 2008-03-03 15:23:51.883::INFO:  Logging to STDERR via
> org.mortbay.log.StdErrLog
> 2008-03-03 15:23:51.929::INFO:  jetty-6.0.2
> 2008-03-03 15:23:52.914::INFO:  Extract
> jar:file:<............>/webui-2.0.0.war!/ to
> <...............>Temp\Jetty_localhost_8080___\webapp
> 2008-03-03 15:24:05.648::INFO:  Started SocketConnector @ localhost:8080
> Heritrix version: ${pom.version}
> 
> Moving on to http://localhost:8080, I need to authenticate.
> From now on, I'm stuck. I type in the right password, click on 'Go',
> and nothing more happens...

When you say 'nothing more happens' -- does that mean the browser hangs, 
spinning, waiting for a response?

Is there any output to the JVM's standard out?

Is there a specific reason you are launching via a Java call to 
Heritrix.main, rather than from a command line or using the bundled 
launch script? (Are you trying to embed Heritrix in something else, 
and/or running on a non-Linux OS?)

Are you working from an SVN checkout or the 2.0.0-distribution bundle?

I don't know what's happening, but I'd guess a necessary library or part 
missing or misconfigured.

- Gordon @ IA
